verbose_text: XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR When we cross the bi-allelic mice outlined above to Tie-2-Cre mice, animals that are Cre positive show significantly decreased levels of claudin-5 protein in their brain when administered doxycycline in their diet (* * * P < 0.001; Figure XREF_FIG) in addition to significantly lower levels of claudin-5 messenger RNA (* * * P < 0.001).
